page.title: 11Footpath Maps, Rutland
page.content: Rutland footpaths are clearly shown in a series of maps drawn by J.E.Garbett of Langham,Rutland.The maps are sold as individual sheets in the Uppingham Bookshop.They are approximately six inches to one mile.Sheets 132,133 and 134 cover the area of Ayston,Ridlington and Preston and are corrected to December 1978.This means that sheet 133 does not show the by-pass which now cuts the Uppingham-Ayston footpath into two parts.The by-pass is indicated on the Ordnance Survey 1:25,000 map of Rutland Water.Footpaths are shown as green,broken lines on this map. Descriptions of footpath walks written by A.M.Fisher in March 1976, accompany the Garbett maps.For instance 'Walk number lV'covers ten miles Ridlington-Belton-Allexton- Loddington-Ridlington.
